reviews.title: Great location and nothing else.
reviews.text: Stayed here with girlfriend for 3 nights and upon arrival we were made to wait over 3 hours to get our room. Staff rude especially when we returned to ask about room earlier than they told us to come back. Nowhere to sit down around reception and really nothing to offer at all. Next time we'll stay nearer the beach area as we missed it big time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for our wedding anniversay and weren't disappointed. Many a time we had walked past on day trips to Palma and thought how nice it looked and in such a great location. We had a room at the front on the 5th floor. It was very clean, great bathroom and quiet, despite the location. My only (minor) gripe was that the mattresses are a tad on the hard side. The minibar prices are extremely reasonable but you can also get almost anything you want in the large department store next door. Breakfast is a treat with a great selection and wonderful coffee (Nespresso). They even cater for no dairy, lactose free etc. Don't miss the roof terrace as it has fabulous views and is a great place to chill out with a glass of wine (theoretically they do now serve drinks but you're best to bring your own). Staff were excellent and spoke perfect english. The location is ideal for sight seeing, bars and restaurants, all within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed one night as they were fully booked for the other two night we wanted due to the Marathon. Great hotel - early check in, comfortable bed, quiet room as requested, pleasant staff on reception, good breakfast with fresh ingredients and huge choice and a Nespresso machine so you can have your perfect cup of coffee. Close to the lovely Passeig del Born and within walking distance of good food and drink spots.Good value.
reviews.title: Great spot in Palma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideally located on Avenue Jaime III with El Corte Ingles and lots of shops either side. 2 minute stroll into the old city narrow streets where you are spoilt for choice on bars and restaurants.5 -10 minute easy walk to Cathedral and Marina area.
reviews.title: Well managed clean friendly hotel in a good location

reviews.text: We went for the premium room ( 715) with balcony and lovely view of the Cathedral and Port about 500 metres away. There is a sun terrace on 8th floor to enjoy if you want to stay in standard rooms. A very acceptable breakfast, including hot food, is served in the second floor dining area. Fast free wifi.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were fortunate to spend three nights in Mallorca at the Hotel Almudaina. Let me confirm what the other reviews mentioned: perfect location, excellent service, amazing views. We couldn't imagine a better choice.
reviews.title: What a Gem!

reviews.text: We booked early and were able to arrange room 804. It is the premier room in the hotel. It is located right off the rooftop lounge.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Look no further - this is the place to stay in Palma de Mallorca.
reviews.title: A good hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is in a very central position in Palma town and close to the airport bus.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a superior room with view towards the port and cathedral which was well worth the extra. It was a very spacious and comfortable room, clean and daily change of towels and regular change of bed linens. Minibar and in room safe.
reviews.title: Good Value in Palma City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just back from a stay in this hotel, spacious and clean room at the back which is quiet with views over rooftops to port, staff very friendly and helpful, amazing views from rooftop terrace on the 8th floor great to sit and relax at night with a bottle of wine taking in the view. Breakfast was very good plenty of choice hot and cold. This hotel is in an ideal position for all Palma's attraction nearby, with helpful,courteous and friendly staff wewill be back.
reviews.title: Great city Location

reviews.text: Our short 3 night break here from February 23rd to the 26th went without a hitch, the rooms were of good standard and kept scrupulous clean, Its location on Jaime lll was ideal being less than 10 minutes walk to all of Palma's main attractions (20min to the Tren de Soller station)The breakfast had a good selection of hot and cold food, and the roof lounge/bar on the eight floor was spectacular with its views over the capital, although it was difficult to get service as the bar was not permanently staffed, due I suspect as to it being not used enough, but with bottles of wine between €6 and €9 it should be. Staff in the reception were professional and courteous and spoke very good english. All in all a perfect city break location.
reviews.title: Perfect City Location

reviews.text: I went in late February with a group. I found the hotel great- great rooms, great location. The staff, however, was one of the worst hotel staff I have ever dealt with. I left 50 euros along with an extra credit card in my passport IN my drawer, and the 50 euros was missing when I came back that night. When I went to file a complaint at the front desk, the receptionist was extremely rude. He basically laughed in my face and suggested that my friend stole it. I will never return.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel but the staff was horrendous

reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights in February, in room 714. There was a balcony with a fantastic view of the Cathedral and the Harbour. The room was clean and comfortable, equipped with a mini-bar, reading chair, desk and a comfortable bed. It was extremely quiet and we could not hear noise from any surrounding rooms (or the street since we were not facing the street with the beautiful panoramic view). The breakfast buffet in the restaurant on the second floor was also first rate--anything anyone could want in the morning. We never tried the offerings in the evening.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A big plus of the hotel is its central location. It is within easy walking distance of the Cathedral and the other tourist attractions. It is only a 10-minute walk from Plaza de Espana where there are trains/buses that could take you anywhere on the island. There is no need to rent a car. Buses/trains will take you anywhere you want to go.
reviews.title: Great location and great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Palma from 19-24 January. The hotel was in a fantastic location as is so close to all the central attractions and all within walking distance.
reviews.title: A good, central destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a superior room (715) on the 7th floor and had great views of the Cathedral to our left, harbour directly in front of us (city rooftops) and Bellver Castle in the distance to the right. Amazing views! The only negative comment I had about this room was the toilet was stained and could be easily cleaned. Cost to hire the safe key = 1.5 euros per day. Unfortunately after day 2 we encountered an issue with the plumbing and a strong stewage odour was coming from the bathroom. We spoke to the staff at the hotel and they empathised and moved us immediately to another room - 804 - WOW! I was very impressed how quickly they reacted to the problem. The new room was excellent (very large double bed, coffee table/comfortable chairs/sofa, large bathroom-no bath, mini bar/fridge, TV with 3-4 English Channels, predominantly news channels), whilst no balcony the panoramic windows opened up completely to enhance the amazing views and we could always use the sun terrace if we wanted to sit outside. The only small negative comment I would say about Room 804 is the bathroom is not enclosed so doesn't provide a private environment when washing etc., and the door opens directly into the Bar which at High Season may prove to be noisy during evening (unless you are joining the party of course)! This however didn't bother us as it was Low Season when we visited.
reviews.title: Perfect location for your city break.

reviews.text: The dining room is on the 2nd floor and offers a good breakfast - continental and a choice of eggs, bacon and mini sausages daily. Fresh juices, yoghurts and lots of pastries to choose from and fresh coffee from the Nespresso machine. It was quiet when we visited so we didn't have to wait for the machine or breakfast items. We took our own coffee making facilities and stored milk in the fridge - no problem! The restaurant on the 2nd floor provide set menus in the evening, but we didn't try. In addition, the bar has a range of food/snacks and drinks available and all reasonably priced. However, at the department store 2 mins from hotel, you can purchase drinks/snacks/picnic items from the supermarket on the lower ground floor. The hotel didn't mind us bringing in our own beer/wine or water.
reviews.title: Great choice hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't hire a car but used the bus system to visit many parts of the island (deserted at many places because of the time of year, but good to see nevertheless). Its a very efficient service (even on a Sunday/Bank Holiday) and very reasonably priced too. The airport bus - Number 1 departs from Passig Mallorca, a 5 minute walk and costs 2.5 euros each, a bargain! Taxi from airport to hotel cost 24 euros (included tip). Unfortunately, we couldn't get the traditional train to Soller as it was undergoing refurbishment until beginning of February :o( so had to travel by bus - not the same but nevertheless a lovely town to visit. Port Soller, whilst closed, would be amazing in the mid-high season!
reviews.title: Nice views but nothing special

reviews.text: We would recommend this hotel if you wanted to be in a central location.
reviews.title: Dont expect any outside space
